page.title: 16QUARRYING IN RESTENNETH
page.content: Fledmyre quarry along with Lochhead quarry is the main {industry}in the area. Fledmyre quarry begun 5 years ago and has worked 7 acres. When it was surveyed they predicted a {mining {life}of 25-30 years producing 400-500 tons per day but to date they often produce in excess of this so it is uncertain if it will last the alloted time. The {quarry's procedure}is that the black top soil is skimmed of the surface to reach the sand and kept for later infilling. Large diggers are used to extract the sand to a legal limit of 2 metres above the water table so as not to pollute the water. The sand is filtered with the biggest stones being removed and the rest are crushed and made into gravel of varying sizes. The{sand and gravel} produced goes mainly to the building trade and road construction.
